Posts.Content: Jun 15, 2010 08:59AM Momto3boys wrote: I read lots of the postings of what people brought to the hospital and about the "visitor" situation.  I was in for 5 days - and 3 of those were pretty much a blur!  I only wanted family to visit - parents, husband and kids.  You will be really tired (exhausted!) after surgery and need the hospital time to rest and regain some strength.  Visitors take energy!  The things I used were slippers (I didn't want to walk the floors of the hospital with the socks they gave me and then get right back into bed with them), lip balm, skin cleansing wipes, hairbrush, and my cell phone (used it to look up phone numbers).  One thing that would have been nice - a lightweight sweater to wear over my hospital gown for when it was a little too cold.  My hospital had various items that I needed - toothbrush, toothpaste, lotion, mouthwash, shampoo, soap, etc.  I wouldn't overdo it with the packing - less to bring home!!
